There are several places in templated functions where scalar values are passed by reference instead of value ([Vector4 constructor](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/12519225abe49c1b59a6768800470e5c009f3694/include/ignition/math/Vector4.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Vector4.hh-48) for example). @iche033 [recently pointed out](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2066/pimplize-light-class#comment-13015303) that it is often better to pass primitive types by value rather than by reference ([reference 1](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10770410/reasons-to-not-pass-simple-types-by-reference) and [reference 2](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14013139/is-it-counter-productive-to-pass-primitive-types-by-reference)).

We can evaluate this sometime if we set up some performance tests. I've marked this as a minor issue for the time being.
content.html:
There are several places in templated functions where scalar values are passed by reference instead of value (Vector4 constructor for example). @iche033 recently pointed out that it is often better to pass primitive types by value rather than by reference (reference 1 and reference 2).

We can evaluate this sometime if we set up some performance tests. I've marked this as a minor issue for the time being.
